news.title: Bihar CM sets January 31 deadline for land survey
news.para: In a proactive move, Bihar's Chief Minister Nitish Kumar has initiated a comprehensive campaign to address the backlog of land measurement requests, aiming for a resolution by January 31, 2026. This step is designed to streamline the process, foster transparency, and minimize land conflicts.

news.title: Haryana RERA asks homebuyers to deal only with registered property agents
news.para: Gurugram RERA has issued a crucial advisory for homebuyers and property investors.  It strongly recommends engaging only with real estate agents registered with the Authority.  Dealing with unregistered intermediaries poses significant legal and financial risks.

news.title: Gurugram buyers go to cops, say ‘pressured’ to withdraw FIR against CHD Developers
news.para: Homebuyers of a stalled housing project in Gurugram have approached the Economic Offences Wing (EOW) alleging they are being pressured to withdraw a criminal case. The FIR, filed in 2020, concerns allegations of cheating and conspiracy against CHD Developers Ltd.

news.title: Noida techie died in one, but several construction site pits are death traps in city
news.para: Deep, unsecured trenches on vacant plots across Noida have become death traps, with a recent incident claiming a software engineer's life. These hazardous excavations, often waterlogged and lacking safety measures, pose a significant risk to commuters, especially during low visibility. Authorities have launched drives to identify and address these dangers.

news.title: Anant Raj's profit rises 31% to ₹144 crore in Q3 FY26
news.para: Anant Raj's consolidated net profit surged by 31 percent to Rs 144.23 crore in December quarter. This growth was driven by an increase in total income, which rose to Rs 660.38 crore. The company is a prominent real estate developer focused on residential and data centre projects.

news.title: PNB Housing Finance's net profit up 7.71% in Q3 FY26
news.para: PNB Housing Finance has unveiled compelling financial results for the quarter that ended on December 31, 2025. Net profit bounced up by 7.71 percent, scoring ₹520.55 crore, as total income climbed by 9.14 percent, reaching an impressive ₹2,120.66 crore.

news.title: Property registrations in Hyderabad rise 14% in December 2025
news.para: Hyderabad's housing market experienced a strong finish to 2025. December saw a significant 14% rise in home registrations compared to the previous year. While full-year volumes were slightly down, the total value of properties registered increased. Higher-value homes, especially those above ₹1 crore, showed robust growth.

news.title: China Vanke wins support for bond repayment plan; imminent default risk recedes
news.para: China Vanke obtained approval from its creditors to reschedule payments on a 1.1 billion yuan bond, a maneuver intended to avert a potential default crisis. Additionally, the firm is engaged in negotiations concerning two more yuan bonds.

news.title: No occupation certificate unless building has sewage plant: Bombay HC to Maharashtra authorities
news.para: The Bombay High Court has mandated that all municipal agencies across Maharashtra withhold Occupancy Certificates unless developers adhere strictly to building regulations and implement effective sewage management systems. This decisive move is aimed at combatting the alarming issue of sewage pollution in rivers.

news.title: Dalmia Bharat's net profit up 93.94% in Q3 FY26
news.para: Dalmia Bharat has reported an impressive surge in its net consolidated profit, soaring by 93.94 percent for the quarter ending December 31, 2025, with a profit after tax of ₹128 crore. Additionally, the company experienced a robust 10.88 percent growth in total income.

news.title: Raymond Realty to develop residential project on 5.62-acre land in Wadala, Mumbai
news.para: Raymond Realty has launched a new residential redevelopment project in Wadala, Mumbai. This project has an estimated revenue potential of around ₹5,000 crore. It will feature premium 2-BHK and 3-BHK homes and retail spaces.

news.title: Mumbai region leads land acquisition activity in 2025 with 32 deals spanning over 500 acres: Anarock
news.para: In 2025, the Mumbai Metropolitan Region emerged as the epicenter of India's vibrant land market, racking up thirty-two deals that spanned over 500 acres. Nationally, 126 significant transactions encompassed more than 3,772 acres, with residential ventures stealing the spotlight. Cities like Bengaluru and Pune weren't far behind, showcasing impressive land deals.

news.title: Labdhi Lifestyle to invest ₹700 crore to develop commercial project in BKC, Mumbai
news.para: Labdhi Lifestyle's project has a gross development value (GDV) of over ₹1,000 crore and will offer 2.25 lakh sq ft of carpet area.

news.title: Mahalunge-Maan town scheme still awaits final nod: PMRDA
news.para: The Mahalunge-Maan town planning scheme, a flagship project approved in principle seven years ago, awaits final clearance from the state Urban Development Department. Delays stem from multiple approvals, technical hurdles including flood line modifications, and the current election code of conduct. This scheme is crucial for funding the PMRDA Inner Ring Road.

news.title: Logitech Electronics India leases office space at BKC for about ₹4 crore
news.para: Logitech Electronics India has secured a new office space in Mumbai's Bandra Kurla Complex. The company will occupy Unit 407 in the Trade Centre building. The total rental outgo for this period is approximately ₹4 crore. The annual rent will see a 5% escalation.

news.title: Wardha cops bust illegal sand mining
news.para: Pulgaon police conducted a successful crackdown against illegal sand mining along the Wardha riverbed. Operations at two locations led to the seizure of vehicles and mobile phones valued at approximately Rs21 lakh and Rs5 lakh respectively. Several individuals were apprehended and cases registered under various acts. The action was guided by senior police officials.

news.title: Buyer raises safety and compliance worries, seeks Haryana RERA, DTCP help
news.para: A homebuyer has approached state authorities with serious concerns regarding a residential project in Gurugram. Issues include possession-linked conditions, safety infrastructure, and regulatory compliance. The buyer cites pressure tactics and unresolved safety issues. The developer states construction is complete and an occupancy certificate is in principle. Authorities are investigating the complaint.

news.title: Over 660 construction sites yet to install air quality monitors, BMC tells Bombay HC
news.para: The BMC informed the Bombay High Court that 662 out of 1,954 construction sites lack sensor-based air quality monitors. The civic body issued hundreds of showcause and stop-work notices for non-compliance with pollution mitigation guidelines. Despite these issues, the BMC claims Mumbai's AQI remained in the moderate range between December 29 and January 15.

news.title: Noida authority rejected Wiztown Planners' revised layout citing violations of Sports City scheme
news.para: Noida Authority rejected Wiztown Planners' revised layout for a Sector 150 plot, citing violations of the Sports City scheme and a commercial complex appearance. The plan proposed significantly more commercial space than permitted, deviating from the sports-led development mandate. This rejection occurred amidst broader scrutiny of Sports City projects, including CAG objections and Supreme Court directives.
